website_summaries.verdict: Reasonable price for an emergency radio with a solar charging option.
pros: Includes a 2,000 mAh power bank, which means it can charge other devices as needed
For cloudy days, it has a hand crank to create the power
Can access AM, FM, and NOAA weather stations
cons: May not survive a fall or rough treatment

customer_reviews.title: Earned a permanent spot in my emergency kit
customer_reviews.text: When Hurricane Florence came into SE North Carolina we lost all power and for a couple days couldn't even fire up the generators. During that period that little hand cranked radio was our lifeline to NOAA weather, local radio reports, keeping our phones charged in hopes of returning cell service and light during the scary screaming winds at night. I must have turned that crank a million times, but it never failed us, and when it was all over it went right into the emergency supplies to be ready for the next one.
customer_reviews.author: davids

customer_reviews.title: A Bit Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This was a Christmas gift to my husband. I suppose I should've researched it better but we discovered there is no headphone jack on the unit. So there is no ability to listen to the radio privately. Second disappointment is that when you tip up the solar panel to optimize catching the sunlight the LED light panel underneath it turns on. Which totaly defeats the solar charging purpose. We have found no way to turn off the LED light panel. It simply turns on when tilted up and turns off when laid flat to the unit. Other than that the radio and flashlights work well. It is to early to see how durable the unit will be.
customer_reviews.author: Woman At Witts End

customer_reviews.title: Most comprehensive feature,s in a small package, for emergency situations
customer_reviews.text: For it's size, about the size of your hand, it has one of the larger USB battery backups (2000mAh) available. Solar panel has a charging light, so you can position it for best charge. Crank handle is not fragile, so unlikely to break in use. Good radio reception. Siren, and red light - not all weather radios have that. This radio is marketed by more than one seller, in various colors, so you may get different offer prices.
customer_reviews.author: O. Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Recharges Via Cell Chager---Very Convenient
customer_reviews.text: I got this to replace the radio in my older model car. I love it. I recharged it with my cell charger and it works great. The flash light is good for walking from my garage to my front door. Even though I haven't had to use the siren, I like knowing its there. Good price. UPDATE: My radio charging port got dislodged and now I can no longer charge. Disappointed it lasted 1 year only.
customer_reviews.author: myra

customer_reviews.title: Good Basic Radio
customer_reviews.text: This is not a radio that you will normally be carrying around the house blasting out your favorite tunes. But when an Emergency strikes this little radio might end up being your only news/weather source from the outside. It is built of durable made to last hard plastic and the solar charger seems to work adequately to provide enough charge. Why wait until the nights are dark without power and you are stumbling around in the dark- buy this radio today and keep in for that "just in case" moment.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer Advocate NC

customer_reviews.title: Great for pool, beach, fishing, camping.  Also emergencies and power outages
customer_reviews.text: Actually really like it. I take it to the pool and the beach decent radio. Convenient and small fits easy in a back pack. Many uses from emergency situations to a plain radi9 that can charge your phone. I would recommend it especially if you are prone to losing power, camping, fishing, etc... easy to use and well worth the $29.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed ...and it was such a great idea too.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item as something perfect for camping or hiking. On its first camping trip the radio completely failed, tried new batteries, tried the crank bit the radio would not tune in to any frequency am FM or weather. It seemed so sturdy too. The flashlight works the alarm works but not the radio. I have never given a one star before but it was supposed to be kind of a surprise at camp since the kids didn't have any of their electronics. It was just a horrible disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Nepos13

customer_reviews.title: Okay quality. Great overall.
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for when it comes to quality. But it’s great value when it comes to options and features. Lots going on with this item. Ability to use batteries was the deciding factor. Great overall. Got it for emergencies.
customer_reviews.author: MVIVID

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this product. It does not work!!!’
customer_reviews.text: It will not tune.... it’s a unworthy piece. I will be sending it back. Do not waste your time ordering.
customer_reviews.author: DhuttonAmazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Radio does not work....
customer_reviews.text: The siren works, the lights work. The radio, not so much. Broke it out during a severe weather event and there was no signal for radio, not even a crackle on any of the options. Basically an expensive flashlight with nuptial option at this point. Should have tested upon receipt as return window has closed.
customer_reviews.author: hlcwach

customer_reviews.title: Internal Battery Charger Broken?
customer_reviews.text: The charger for the internal lithium battery has an LED charging indicator that is supposed to go out after 4 or 5 hours. Instead it stays on continuously, so there is no way to know if the internal battery is fully charged or not, or if it is charging at all. Overcharging a lithium battery is a fire hazard. Purchased two of these and returned both within a couple of days. Would gladly pay more for something more reliable.
customer_reviews.author: OddScott

customer_reviews.title: Hand Crank is a lot harder to use than it seems
customer_reviews.text: The hand crank needs to be wound fast (140 rpm) for a long time (>5 minutes) in order to work. This is a lot more tiring than it sounds. Also, no instruction manual came with it, which was annoying for the people that actually bother reading those. It was available online, but it was hard to find because the titles to the links were weird. Overall, a good product. The radio works well, it's small and compact, and it has a good price for what you get.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Not worth 30 dollars
customer_reviews.text: Just one star because not a single local channel comes in,we are getting one station and that’s it,even went outside with a different radio,which worked just fine,very disappointed,thought I could pick up a couple of locals which would be the norm if things would work the correct way,so don’t waste your money,I read the reviews before I ordered and wonder now where they are all coming from
customer_reviews.author: Northern

customer_reviews.title: Really easy to use, intuitive design. And I feel more prepared!
customer_reviews.text: I just got this item and had not seen one before, but was able to just crank it by hand a few times, turn it on, and was listening to a very detailed weather report within about a minute of opening the box. Very cool little device. I live on an island in hurricane territory and this is forecast to be a heavy hurricane year. I feel much better knowing I have a way non-battery:electrical-outlet-dependent way to access emergency information should I lose internet and cellular data access.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Read the details carefully!
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure is a great product, but it not exactly what I expected. I was expecting something a lot larger. More than anything I'm more upset that I didn't get back the full value that I paid for (2 items) thank to return shipping and handling. Oh well, I certainly going to be more careful and not just look at the picture(s). Lol
customer_reviews.author: Mcsllew

customer_reviews.title: Everything works fine
customer_reviews.text: Some folks commented too small. My intent was for an emergency kit so I didn’t want something huge. This is just right. The sound of the radio is fine. And I get thdzweather station for this area and several major AM and FM stations. The solar light is bright and so isxthe “torch” flashlight. I’ve tested everything off the LI-ION battery. Haven’t put the triple As in yet. Haven’t tried charging my phone on it yet either.
customer_reviews.author: L. Slimp

customer_reviews.title: Good to have in an emergency.  Lower cost purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Radio kind of tinney sounding but not surprised. Full charge by solar and supplemental cranking was pretty quick. Used the reading light it was very nice. For low cost purchase I'm pleased with results. Oh, don't try the SOS siren with a cat sitting on your lap. You will get slashed up!
customer_reviews.author: Trax22

customer_reviews.title: I can dig it~,
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use, multiple ways of charging, durable (I'm pretty clumsy) take it with on road and camping trips as it does have the Weather station, has both FM and AM station, two different lights, sos "siren" that's pretty loud.
customer_reviews.author: Hippie Chef

customer_reviews.title: Emergency handheld radio
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to keep my cell phones charged during a storm or hurricane. What a joke. The battery was fully charged in the radio but it took almost 3 hours to get my cell phone charged to 75%. Bad purchase on my part. And why didn't I send it back? Because the radio works great with the emergency light. Sending it back would have cost me even with me having "Prime" and it's an argument that I didn't want to deal with.
customer_reviews.author: Brob

customer_reviews.title: World's Tiniest Radio
customer_reviews.text: This thing just arrived and I'm still laughing. I feel like I'm on the set of Austin Powers and am trying to listen to "The world's tiniest radio". On the plus side, It does work as advertised... lights, ion and AAA batteries, radio, solar, etc... but man it's so small! I'm glad its yellow or I could easily lose it. I'm giving this two stars and putting it in my camping gear... for now.
customer_reviews.author: Herman

customer_reviews.title: Great radio and light features for camping
customer_reviews.text: Good reception sound is clear and volume easy for travel and emergency
customer_reviews.author: karla winter

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: I had a chance to try this product out over the past 2 days as a tree came down on my power lines leaving me without power for 1 1/2 days and was stuck with only this nightmare of a tool to get by. First off, the lithium ion battery DOES NOT CHARGE off of solar power. Second off, its a waste to even try and use without batteries to burn through as the only real way to power it is a useless and exhausting hand crank. Finally the product came about a 3rd of the size it looks like in pictures. Do yourself a favor and pass on this piece of junk save yourself from the nightmare I lived!
customer_reviews.author: scott wesney

customer_reviews.title: No instructions
customer_reviews.text: I did not get any product instructions or cables. Has a slot for USB and DC, but not cords provided. Couldn't get the weather band to work, contacted Amazon support and discovered on the right side (facing radio) at top you pull out an antenna, then gently up and extend fully to get weather band. Didn't realize you pulled up solar power panel and it was a stand alone light.
customer_reviews.author: Pegacorn

customer_reviews.title: Quite simply, it doesn't work.
customer_reviews.text: Based on its high rating, I bought one of these for a friend, and one for myself. As for my experience, I get nothing but static on both the FM and AM bands. (Yes, I installed batteries, installed them properly, had the switches on the right settings, read the instructions, and checked and re-checked everything, tried it every which-way, for 45 minutes.) Based on other reviews, I must have bought a lemon, but I can only review the item I received, no one else's.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen J. Triesch

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work
customer_reviews.text: Great size radio, but sadly during a PG&E public safety power shut off, while I was also on an advisory evacuation notice for a fire, this radio failed. The solar setting wouldn't work at all. It would work on batteries (which thankfully I had) and it would work by turning the crank. It would only charge my cell phone by turning the crank. This item was returned for a refund... I will keep looking for a radio that will perform like needed during emergency situations like I faced.
customer_reviews.author: LReviews

customer_reviews.title: A bit heavy
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't recommend this one for backpackers because it is on the heavy side. It's a nice little unit, and everything came in working order. I would recommend this for all non backpackers
customer_reviews.author: VJ

customer_reviews.title: Manage Expectations of this Product
customer_reviews.text: I thought this radio/flashlight had more heft based on the ad's image. This product is the size of a whiteboard eraser with additional 2" of length and width. The plastic body is thin and if it's dropped, it's finished. The controls are equally miniature and perform well as long as you don't have thick fingers. It reminds of a transistor radio I bought in the 60's. You must read the instructions to learn the process for charging the battery. Flipping switches are necessary for charging this product. The solar panel seems to work. I wish the plastic body was a few millimetres thicker to ensure it's not accidentally crushed while holding it.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Loduca

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: So I bought this and tossed it in our emergency kit. Go figure a few months later we have rolling power outages in California and sure enough - we lost power for over 24 hours. This was a life saver! For about 8 hours my 3 year old son carried it around, dropped it a couple times. Taking the antenna up and down and of course playing with the lights and radio. It held up! Works well!! Glad I bought it!
customer_reviews.author: TJMay

customer_reviews.title: The battery case requires a very small phillips head screwdriver
customer_reviews.text: An emergency item needs to come with any necessary tools included. The battery case on this radio requires a very small phillips-head screwdriver, not an item that most people probably have. The battery case either needs to not require a tool or the item needs to come with the appropriate tool.
customer_reviews.author: Val T

customer_reviews.title: Rad little radio.
customer_reviews.text: I love this radio and it does everything I will hope to need it for. Sounds great as well, I think. My only suggestion would be to beef up the antenna a bit. Ive went to close it a few times already and have to pace myself as not to bend or break it off trying to get it back in the housing, and without it the signal is not the best. Would be great a tad smaller as well for packability. I feel like the flashlight takes a lot of real estate, and most people who have this will already have much better flashlights for the same size. A tiny LED should suffice.
customer_reviews.author: Aperture40

customer_reviews.title: Nope, won’t charge a phone
customer_reviews.text: Sooo... placed in direct sunlight for 4 plus hours, would only charge 2% on my phone. Used hand crank 30 minutes ( but with some short breaks probably 20 minutes) wouldn’t charge my phone, placed in nice hot bright sunlight (84 degrees clear skies) red light showed it was charging for nearly 5 hours, still only charged my phone 2% and it would ding periodically like it was disconnected then reconnected.
customer_reviews.author: littlebit_atrh

customer_reviews.title: Perfect addition to my emergency kit
customer_reviews.text: I live in California where we not only have the threat of earthquakes, but where rolling power outages are used to help stave off wildfires. I decided to add a crank flashlight to my emergency kit because when we need a flashlight in a hurry, the batteries are the weakest link. I ran across this radio, weather radio, flashlight, power source and I bought it. There are four ways to charge this little radio flashlight (solar, crank, USB, or AAA batteries). The radio works fine and you can switch between normal radio and weather radio. I haven't had to test the length of the battery charge yet, but everything else is just what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Melisa Blankenship

customer_reviews.title: Tiny little product, but impressive none the less.
customer_reviews.text: It is a bit smaller than the impression you get in the pictures, but all in all, a good product. The weather alert station works well. Radio is impressive for such a small item. The flashlight is no more than a standard light, BUT, the reading light on the top of this little guy is super bright. The crank for charging is smooth & the solar panel is sturdy. It does its job.
customer_reviews.author: Jae Mullis

customer_reviews.title: Purchased this for my Emergency Preparedness resolution
customer_reviews.text: This radio works exactly as it is advertised (I was expecting at least one wrinkle or two haha), I have already recommended it to a few friends. The form factor is small, so it doesn't take up much space, and the light it gives off is more than sufficient for lighting a dark room. I have admittedly not tested the solar panel yet, but the hand crank definitely works, and will charge a phone. The hand crank is a short throw, so a little more RPM is needed to charge the battery than some larger radios. Overall, I am very happy with the purchase, hoping I don't need to use it :)
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Doerr

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality & Doesn't Work
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this so I could charge my phone in the event of a power outage no matter what, & to hear radio weather updates. Well that time came on Aug 10 when Iowa was hit with a devastating derecho storm & this thing failed miserably. It wouldn’t charge my phone & said “accessory not supported” and the radio signal and quality was crap. It’s basically a very expensive, low-quality flashlight since that’s the only thing that worked. Disappointed I wasted my money.
customer_reviews.author: KEB88

customer_reviews.title: Not exactly what I'd want in a real emergency
customer_reviews.text: Definitely doesn't look or feel very sturdy. Also the light in the front is on all the time. It seems to just take from the ambient light in the room and bleed continuously.
customer_reviews.author: Kcreich

customer_reviews.title: Product  Critically needed on disaster events
customer_reviews.text: The new product is handy for any disaster situation. I live in an area of earthquakes, when,if it occurred, possibly all communications, light and power will be lost. In this effort the product could resolve several emergency issues, like power/light. By using the product I could charge my cell phone which would allow me to contact resources needed in that emergency. Similarly, the unit light and radio would be enormous help in in those situations. I am glad I got it and plan to donate one unit to another family member Thank you Joseph
customer_reviews.author: Joseph J. Lisboa

customer_reviews.title: Great little radio
customer_reviews.text: The radio works great, I got stations in clearly on AM/FM and weather band. The light is bright and could substitute a regular flashlight in a pinch. The SOS warning on this is LOUD(duh), but is controlled by a switch on the bottom that i fear could be bumped accidentally with relative ease. The charging indicators light up for both solar power and hand crank power, though I'm fairly doubtful they generate any useful amount of power. Though overall a useful little device that could be invaluable in an emergency.
customer_reviews.author: B. K.

customer_reviews.title: A must have for any household!
customer_reviews.text: They say in a disaster you need a radio just like this so I bought this after some research. Its wild just how many ways it can power up hand crank, batteries and USB and some others I haven't read into yet. This is exactly what you need for things like natural disasters. I live on the coast of Georgia so hurricanes are a real issue. The sound quality isn't the greatest, but this isn't meant to be for entertainment. Having this little guy gives me piece of mind.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Cool little emergency radio
customer_reviews.text: Everything is built into one! I had a very early version of a solar/crank power/battery radio from 20+ years ago. It was barely, sadly adequate. But this nifty radio has a USB port, VERY bright beam, and ability to take either rechargeable lithium batteries or regular batteries. I bought a set of lithium batteries so that the solar and crank powers can recharge them. The batteries are good for 20 years and do not leak acid when they get old. What could be better? We live in No. CA where we are experiencing massive wildfires and we just went through 5 days of power outage to AVOID fires. This radio will come in very handy.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Ann

customer_reviews.title: Compact and durable.
customer_reviews.text: One of those things you hope you never really need. We have tested it out, charging, lights, usb...Compact and durable.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley C.

customer_reviews.title: Thought it was bigger but good enough. bought this because need to be prepared for earthquakes
customer_reviews.text: it works and tested it on my phone. you need this if there is an earthquake or loss of power. hand crank mechanism to charge your phone, plus a radio. the last time we had a power outage i was in my car listening to the radio. they were telling us who needs to boil water. my car battery can only last so long, plus i could not even buy gas with debit card, so keep some cash around too. things to think about, and this item gives me a big relief.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Viray

customer_reviews.title: Good addition to your emergency kit
customer_reviews.text: This compact radio/light is easy to use and can be hand-cranked for power or there is a compartment for AAA batteries (great when the C and D batteries sell out at the store!). It won't replace more powerful flashlights, but I can see it being super useful when you've lost power and need a connection to emergency radio etc. I really love the USB/micro USB ports for keeping phones etc. charged and the solar panel is a plus. I may get a second one for my car and additional ones as gifts. Very useful and when you need it, you'll be happy you have it.
customer_reviews.author: Palmetto Dreamer

customer_reviews.title: As advertised.
customer_reviews.text: I liked the charger's multiple features and size, and that I can charge its battery with a phone micro USB charger. Weather radio is nice for travel and camping. Flashlight ahd reading light are a plus. Hand cranking is hard for me and time consuming, the emergency flasher and siren are alarming, that's for sure. Over all I think its a good value.
customer_reviews.author: Chicken Jim

customer_reviews.title: Worth having!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for a camping trip with the Boy Scouts. If you use the AAA battery option to charge your phone it does not get a full charge, but everything else was great. So don’t count on it for that! Other than that we were up pretty far in the mountains and were able to get a decent radio signal. (Both weather radio and FM with the Antenna fully extended.) The boys loved sitting around and cranking it A month later we had some tornadoes come though and knock out power so the weather radio part was a life safer. 100 percent worth the investment
customer_reviews.author: Sara-Alizabeth

customer_reviews.title: I use this full time at my off grid cabin. Well made and long batt life.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this radio! I had another one but the sound was crappy and batt life was only a few hours. This new one will play the radio over 8 hours and I keep it hooked to my USB plug so it is always charged and running off my own power system and uses micro-amps so no real drain at all and ready for camping when needed. The old one wouldn't play the radio when it was charging. Everyone should have an emergency radio with weather band and to get local news reports IMO.
customer_reviews.author: LaMar

customer_reviews.title: Storm Prep!
customer_reviews.text: With all the climate changes and more frequent, more intensive storms, I thought this would be a good decision. I like that there is a cord that allows me to also charge my phone. It came working right out of the box! I have had the chance to use it for an extended period of time yet.... but so far so good!!
customer_reviews.author: Kathi

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this emergency radio since there were so many features and was rated highly. There was a switch to toggle between the radio function and the SOS function. No matter where the switch was placed, the loud SOS sound blared. So I could not even tune or listen to the radio. I returned this item.
customer_reviews.author: BeTheSunshine

customer_reviews.title: Does not charge phone
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product solely to charge my phone in an emergency. I have plenty of other battery and hand crank powered flashlights and radios. This device does NOT charge my phone unless the device itself has been charged from a power source (wall plug, computer, etc.) With the device fully charged, my phone charged from 10% to 19%. Not great, but OK for emergencies, but not even as good as a cheap little power stick. The problem is that the device's solar/AAA battery/hand crank power sources are NOT SUFFICIENT to give a mobile phone any charge at all. Customer service was very responsive via email, but ultimately the product is not what's implied.
customer_reviews.author: DavidR

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good for the Price
customer_reviews.text: Given the "Amazon Choice" rating I guess my expectations were a little higher. Overall quality appears to be ok, and all the added features are good. But the sound is pretty bad. Reminds me of an old early transistor radio (before your time for lots of you). Also the dials are small and hard to read, especially if you need cheater glasses like me to read. All-in-all though it will serve the purpose and earns its place in my Emergency Kit,
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: Does not charge phones!!!
customer_reviews.text: Does not charge phones!! We lost our power for two days we had this in our emergency box pulled it out and everything worked great except the phone charger super upsetting when your on a 30% with two kids with nothing to do besides play some games, watch a movie, ect on the phone. Hoping that the seller reaches out to me to fix this. Ps. We used multiple chargers and phones none worked just flickered charging not charging
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth R.

customer_reviews.title: Multiple functions and power options
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for use in an RV, but it is small and light enough for bikepacking and maybe even backpacking. So many functions in one device with multiple power options! The reading light is good enough for regular use and the flashlight is quite powerful. Emergency alert is loud enough to use as a panic button to scare off intruders. Not sure if the charger will charge my power hog smart phone completely but it should give enough for an emergency call, which is the main need. Great price, rugged construction.
customer_reviews.author: Greybirds2

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Device
customer_reviews.text: I live in tornado alley and we bought this for our emergency bag. The lantern and flashlight are pretty bright. The radio has a retractable antenna to help get better reception, and the volume can get quite loud. We tried charging our phone with the hand crank and solar and works pretty well. Perfect addition to our emergency bag!
customer_reviews.author: sara

customer_reviews.title: Fell short
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving a mixed review.. Concept is really cool if it all worked. We bought it for storm season for the weather radio and the back up power was an added appeal. The radio barely comes in, we have to be standing near a window with our hand on the antenna to even be able to get close to a single which is the last thing you need to be doing in severe weather. Also does nothing for charging a phone. Only plus is the flash light and solar light are bright for power outages. Wouldn't recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Tullas

customer_reviews.title: It Works As Advertised!
customer_reviews.text: Soon as I received this baby, I tested it: AM works great, FM works great, got two NOAA channels that were reporting on latest hurricanes just south of Louisiana, lights work great, battery charger works great, hand crank works great. Guess that sums it up: WORKS GREAT! Plus, it fits inside a cargo pocket of my pants and the second one fits inside my glove box of suv. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Peter Panski

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: It is just as described. I tried everything out and it works great! It is small so easy to carry in backpack or tote. The radio comes in loud & clear. AM, FM & weather channel. I live in Florida so this is a necessity. Several ways to get power which I like and if all else fails you have the crank. It has a USB port & a standard slot for charging your cell phone! Sturdy/well made.....I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: S. Keene

customer_reviews.title: Want to laugh?
customer_reviews.text: Give a 'dial' radio to a millenial! My daughter had such a fun time tuning the radio to different stations (I guess she didn't know that the air is full of radio waves?) AND the world band stations really blew her mind! A fun Father's day for all. But seriously, this little gadget is easy to use, easy to crank, and has every feature you can think of! I'm glad it's in our emergency kit! A good value!
customer_reviews.author: NancyMc

customer_reviews.title: Great size and features
customer_reviews.text: I bought this radio to keep in our emergency supply kit we have in our home. It is compact and has so many features. We plan on using it for camping and in emergencies and it appears to be just the right combination of features and price. It did a good job charging my iphone on day 1. Radio is clear and speaker is decent. Nice item.
customer_reviews.author: TC

customer_reviews.title: Good light to use when all your power is off.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter who lives in a 24 story apartment building in Philly and the power is always going off. She returned from work and found the power off again. There are generators which allowed her to get to her apartment on the 21st floor, but it was dark. She used the powerful reading light and proceeded to read till the power came back on. She said she liked that it had a lot of features but has not had to use them yet.
customer_reviews.author: Lucky Lyndy

customer_reviews.title: Just fine, at least I think so!
customer_reviews.text: I haven't gotten to test this product in a disaster (I hope I never do), it seems to have what it should, and all the functions work just fine. I don't understand why some reviewers are complaining about the sound. Did they expect movie theater surround sound out of a $25 AM/FM emergency radio? Man, people are hard to please these days...
customer_reviews.author: Lightning Hunter

customer_reviews.title: A Reliable Emergency Radio
customer_reviews.text: I bought the FosPower Emergency radio to use during power outages. It's a good thing that I did! During yesterday's power outage in my hometown, the radio kept a strong, reliable signal the entire time that we were without power and its flashlight also kept my room well lit in the dark. I didn't get a chance to test the radio's hand crank or power bank capabilities , though, so I can't comment at this time on how well these features work. On the whole, though, I am pleased with the FosPower Emergency radio so far and recommend it for anyone looking for a compact, reliable, and affordable emergency radio.
customer_reviews.author: A.J.

customer_reviews.title: Weak reception
customer_reviews.text: I thought it was a weather alert radio, very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Livingston

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to our emergency kit.
customer_reviews.text: I'm very pleased with the product so far. It is compact, all features are functioning and we will give it a trial run for the next week. Will update this review after that. It came with a simple diagram explaining the radio's features and how to locate them. It also gave us a web site address to obtain operation instructions and register the warranty. It was packaged well and arrived in a timely manner.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: compact weather radio
customer_reviews.text: I bought this radio for the upcoming tornado season. It is very compact and the sound and lights seem to be good. Have not had to go to the basement yet so that will be the real test. I like the option of a solar panel. It fits easily in a little backpack I plan to take with me when running from these midwest storms. This was shipped very fast. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Phyllis Hook

customer_reviews.title: Prepper purchase
customer_reviews.text: The radio reception is about what you'd expect. Has some good features, but I look at this as more a "spot duty" item. Long range durability may be in question. Small enough to put in a backpack easily.
customer_reviews.author: homertoeclipper

customer_reviews.title: Excellent multi-function tool..
customer_reviews.text: The charging with USB, Solar, and hand crank are all viable, although the hand cranking could get very tedious after the four hours it requires for a full charge. the lights are useful, with the spot having a simple to use angle adjustment. We live in an area where there is no AM/FM radio signal at all, and were pleasantly surprised to find we could clearly receive a weather forecast channel. Highly recommend this for emergency, hiking, biking, backpacking, or just traveling by whatever mode. Great addition to a 72 hour evacuation kit.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Best all around weather radio
customer_reviews.text: This is the best little radio I’ve ever had. It almost sounds vintage, which I enjoy because I listen to classical music. The features are so handy, and with 4 ways to gain battery power you can’t beat it for hurricane preparedness. The crank is great quality, the size is perfect, and the lights are bright. The SOS siren is very VERY loud! Don’t let kids get hold of it. Even the mini carabiner clip is heavy and good quality. I was so impressed I ordered another one for my dad as a birthday gift. 100% recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Jules

customer_reviews.title: DOn't bother, do a lot of research and buy a better radio
customer_reviews.text: I returned this after a few days of testing it. I only used the hand crank of power a that's the whole purpose of have and emergency radio. It charged well, lights worked, siren too all fine. It received radio signal on all bands WB, AM, etc until I took it out to the river and tried it . Couldnt hear it well, didnt pick up stations and no Weather Band could be found. I say ead, ask, test others but skip the Fospower, you cannot afford to be wrong in a emergency.
customer_reviews.author: james l. taylor

customer_reviews.title: Emergency Radio Does So Much More!
customer_reviews.text: This little radio had very good audio. It was so useful during Hurricane Laura. It was anazing how many useful items it has. All included is a Broadband, FM, AM radio, flashlight with flashing option, SOS call and signal, antenna, battery and solor capabilities, cell phone charger, belt hook, 3 power sources, reading lamp all in a tiny 14 oz. plastic rectangle! You won't be sorry buying this radio.
customer_reviews.author: txbluebonnet.

customer_reviews.title: Not reliable
customer_reviews.text: With the FosPower being fully charged, it would not charge my iPhone XR more than 10%. This was very disappointing to find out when I was deep in the woods and needed to rely on this emergency power bank... will be researching reliable power banks for my next trip.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great little radio
customer_reviews.text: I love the size and sturdiness of this radio. My husband plans to use it in the yard while weeding but it's primary purpose is an emergency radio during our nasty tornado season. We have it sitting on a window sill trickle charging with the solar panel so we can grab it on the way to shelter. We've tested the weather band and both commercial bands inside the shelter which is steel and do get reception. We keep alkaline batteries in our go bag so that option will be handy. Will update after the next storm.
customer_reviews.author: RetiredGeek

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: great radio it is a bit small but for emergency use or power outages it is perfect with the 2 lights and solar powering of the battery just 1 of the 3 different ways to power it and the alarm on bottom is quite nice very loud and a bright red light could be a nice deterrent for highway or poorly lit parking when alone
customer_reviews.author: Neal

customer_reviews.title: Just get it!
customer_reviews.text: It’s hard to spend my money on something that I can’t check out in person. To touch...handle...click buttons...generally mess with prior to splashing out my money! I must be jaded & suspicious of online purchasing... So...I took the chance on this little baby as I wanted to fill out my family’s “go bag” a bit...I’m glad I did! Bottom line; it works for me! It’s small, lightweight...cranks, lights up...It’s now an important part of this family...emergency situation or not!
customer_reviews.author: seana

customer_reviews.title: The day it arrived....
customer_reviews.text: So being the clumsy person I tend to be at times, the day it arrived - while removing it from the packaging...I dropped it....oops! I thought to myself..."dang it, well I just wasted that money"...I figured it would malfunction since I heard something rattling around in it - after I dropped it - of course. Well, after a few moments of wiggling it around - I was able to retrieve the little part that was tinkering around on the inside...long story short...GA had severe weather last night and it worked better than I thought (cool beans), I am pleased with my purchase!!!!
customer_reviews.author: O. L. Harris-Austin

customer_reviews.title: Get this one out of all the others
customer_reviews.text: This radio was the best one out of all the other ones that were on Amazon honestly it works great I sat and cranked it for about 25 minutes just sitting there while it was charging my phone as well and I got a decent charge on my phone for the time of not having it charged if you have to pick one get this one
customer_reviews.author: matthew

customer_reviews.title: As described
customer_reviews.text: There are absolutely no instructions as to its operation. This was purchased for a hurricane readiness kit and leaning its operation once will no assist when it's needed. I did figure it out but it should have basic instructions. Also it took way too long to arrive and not as promoted. It looks ok and seems to operate properly.
customer_reviews.author: TC

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a battery operated radio for emergencies. Then I found out they have battery operated radios with solar charging, crank charging, and it can charge my cell phone. Perfect. The radio is ok sound wise, but in an emergency, as long as I can get some stations, I’m good. I charged my iPhone with it so that works. The solar worked and the crank worked although I don’t know how much you have to crank to keep it going, but at least I have options.
customer_reviews.author: DT

customer_reviews.title: ESSENTIAL for all circumstances
customer_reviews.text: We love our solar and hand crank radio! Living in FL (Hurricane central), it's a much needed NECESSITY to have backup power and communication radio for emergencies. Our last radio was just hand crank which was nice but it's so much better that it is solar and it can charge ahead of time. It's very durable and has a rugged exterior - and the LED lights very bright. To top it off, the USB is great to charge those cell phones. We'll definitely be buying more for our family.
customer_reviews.author: Karina

customer_reviews.title: Great survival tool
customer_reviews.text: Love this pocket sized radio/ charger. It was a little smaller than I expected but it has great features to carry in a back pack. Good sound quality. Good flashlight. I am not sure if I could read by the “reader light” but it definitely has a lot packed into a small space.
customer_reviews.author: raquel odell

customer_reviews.title: Guess I got a bad one
customer_reviews.text: Does not work. Turns on but no volume and now I can’t return it. :( waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Smarty2777

customer_reviews.title: It's what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: Several nice features, and I wanted a simple radio for emergencies. It's nice and small, picked up our local NOAA emergency broadcast station but it didn't match the station number on the radio dial, but that's not a problem. I like the flashlight and sos flash, and it has a pretty serious siren. It'll do the job, I hope I never need it, but I'm really glad I've got it if I do.
customer_reviews.author: Cottage Farm

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Everything worked as should when we received our unit . The solar charger doesn't need to be tilted to charge, and the radio worked excellent with the antenna extended out. To all the people that wrote in about the radio, charging, lights etc.. go online and read the manual for it. Would have been nice to get that with the unit, but it didn't. Time will tell, but so far I would recommend this for your home and I am happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice value
customer_reviews.text: The unit seems to be durable and all the features worked as advertised. Not a rich sound, but given it's intended use, that isn't particularly critical to me.
customer_reviews.author: Dr E

customer_reviews.title: Smaller and less powerful than you may think
customer_reviews.text: My unhappiness with this product is solely mine I was looking for something with more power in the hand crank to charge my cell phone . Radio works great, flashlight is Brite and the hand crank works however ya really have to crank it up to get a full charge on your fone .
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Anthony

customer_reviews.title: USB charger doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to get this, we get a lot of black outs in winter. Yesterday we had our first one. I tried to charge my phone because it was about to die, but plugging it in to showed it was charging but the battery life never went up. It actually was still dropping even though it was "charging". And yes I had it turned to the right switches. Radio part works, but so disappointing that it doesn't charge...guess I'll have to shop around for something else.
customer_reviews.author: LOTRFreak88

customer_reviews.title: Life saver
customer_reviews.text: Had a power outage, and my neighbors were angry, for they waked around with flashlights. For the solar power cell and battery charged came in handy. I connected my smart phone to this equipment and had enough power to make calls and text. I love it. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: loabon

customer_reviews.title: Only one issue with it.
customer_reviews.text: I love the AAA or lithium ion battery option. It charges decent in the sun. But with it fully charged it stopped charging my cell at 80% while I was on a camping trip. The radio still had power but thats all it charged on multiple occasions. But overall it is an amazing item.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Broken flashlight, bad at charging
customer_reviews.text: I'm a little disappointed in this product. The lens for the flashlight broke off the first month I had it. The battery is limited so, I wouldn't get this if you plan to use to charge your phone either. The radio is pretty decent on it though and the hand crank can keep it going in a pinch. You can probably do better elsewhere
customer_reviews.author: Kyle W. Sickau

customer_reviews.title: Manual useless, radio DOA
customer_reviews.text: You have to go online to get the user manual and what you find is a single Adobe document about 18" long. So, you can only get part of it to print unless you shrink to print and then you get a page with text so small it's impossible to read. Since this device is not something you use often be prepared to have a fully operational computer available during your emergency if you need help the the instructions. Also the radio was DOA on mine.
customer_reviews.author: Not impressed

customer_reviews.title: So far, so ok...
customer_reviews.text: There has not been an emergency yet, but I did test out the radio, flashlight while on a drive recently just to see if it worked. The radio was able to pick up a few local stations and the flashlight/reading light were nice and bright. The hand crank appears to work, but I've not vigorously tested it. The sound on the radio is ok, but I don't pickup as many stations as I would like, and there's a lot of static. Overall, the radio and flashlight would do ok in an emergency and I would not be left in a lurch.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Didn't pick up any weather bands
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Light worked well, lightweight, sound was ok. Cons: Didn't pick up any weather bands. I used to have a midland before my son broke it so I know there are some in range. Frankly of no use without this feature so returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Do not submerge this device !!!!!!! Great product
customer_reviews.text: I was extremely shocked about the quality of this device it is sturdy efficient and dependable. Now what I do not like about it...... do not and I repeat do not submerge this radio into water it is not water proof it is water resistant. I used it in the field in the rain and put it in a large ziplock bag and the sound it still awesome, the lights worked well into the night and during the day light it still charged like it should with the solar panel.
customer_reviews.author: William Dutton

customer_reviews.title: Lot of features
customer_reviews.text: I charged the li-ion battery overnight. It must not come with much of a charge. The radios work, the light are bright. 150rpm is a pretty fast crank for charging, but I can do it. The emergency sound really is loud! Someone complained that the reading light came on when the solar collector was tipped! You are outside when you want to use the collectors. Use a stone to set the angle!! You are inside when you need the light!
customer_reviews.author: W. E. Cook

customer_reviews.title: Great emergency kit
customer_reviews.text: The device is great for all what it does in 1 package. A analog radio is must have when it comes to emergency situations do 5 stars on that. The Led light is a little weak in comparison to a $10 LED flashlight but it does help. The downside for me was the batter charger. I tired to charge my phone but my battery never got fully charged before the backup battery was dead, so I give a 4 stars on that. I haven't test the solar function so I still need to test that. Other than that, the device is good for the price.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: In my area, worst radio ever
customer_reviews.text: The bottom battery cover broke off. The battery cannot be replaced once it dies as it is not a standard size. Reception was the worst of any radio I have tried in our area. I finally gave the FosPower to charity who probably threw it away.
customer_reviews.author: ThatCyberSecurityGuy, LLC

customer_reviews.title: So glad I got one with AM/FM...really handy.
customer_reviews.text: Put this to the test about 1 week after receiving. We were evacuated for 5 days due to wildfire in Sonoma County. Very handy to have when no Wi-Fi, electrical etc. Gave a lower rating for easy to use because the directions online to print out are way too small to read. can't enlarge. Contacted company but got the same from them. They should provide a manual that comes with product and normal font size.
customer_reviews.author: Debra S.

customer_reviews.title: Peace of mind
customer_reviews.text: I purchased for myself since living in TORNADO ALLEY. I love all the options so much, that I purchased one for each of my children. They were like little kids in a candy store! Adult men finding the little boys in them.... hilarious
customer_reviews.author: Grace

customer_reviews.title: Awesome radio for emergency or just to have around.
customer_reviews.text: My wife did the research that made us decide on these. And what an awesome decision she made! These radios work great! (we bought two) I am amazed at how many stations they pick. We bought them to keep in our go bags. The batteries, solar, and crank all work perfectly. The lights work great. The radio feels well built. We're always telling someone to buy one these radios.
customer_reviews.author: OpenHonest&Truthful

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased for our emergency radios
customer_reviews.text: Was a bit concerned as there always seems to be negative reviews. The lights are bright, radio works wonderfully, and a pile to receive a clear NOAA band immediately with little effort. Very pleased and I will order 3 more for our car emergency kits.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Holt

customer_reviews.title: Great for Power Outages
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for when the power is out. My daughter bought one just before the scheduled PG&E power shut-off due to winds. It operates on AAA batteries, solar power, or hand crank. The sound quality was very good. We were able to keep up with what was happening while she was here. When she went back to her house, we decided we needed one too. It is compact and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Stoddard

product_meta.title: FosPower Emergency Solar Hand Crank Portable Radio, NOAA Weather Radio for Household and Outdoor Emergency with AM/FM, LED Flashlight, Reading Lamp, 2000mAh Power Bank USB Charger and SOS Alarm
feature_bullets: [2000MAH POWER BANK WILL KEEP DEVICES POWERED] FosPower's emergency radio incorporates a 2000mAh power bank capable of providing emergency power to any small tablet or phone.

[3 POWER SOURCES POWER WHEN YOU NEED IT] Use the emergency weather radio's 3 power sources when you need a boost of power or need to recharge the radio. The radio's crank lever and solar panel are both capable of regenerating enough power to keep the radio, lights, and SOS alarm ready to go when you need it most. AAA Batteries ensure you have power when not able to regenerate power.

[2 LIGHT SOURCES ALWAYS POWERED] The emergency crank radio can also provide light. The 4 LED reading light and 1W flashlight provides enough output to keep you and your loved ones out of the dark in an emergency situation.
[NOAA EMERGENCY WEATHER BROADCAST ACCESS] The radio will dependably receive up to the second emergency weather forecasts and emergency news broadcasts from NOAA and AM/FM stations.
